title: What are my chances for an Annulment? Or do I get a Divorce?
question: I want to get an annulment with my husband. He is fraud of his character and lied and hid his debts that he owe which is 35,000,00+. We have a car together. Car payments are for 5yrs. I dont want the car nor do I want his money. I am by the way 9weeks pregnant so now a baby is involved. He is a military vet and has a very bad mental condition. He was fine up untill his mom falsely accused me of cheating thats when his mental health kicked in and he tried killing himself. I do have 3 other kids and are just looking out for my kids.
answers: Annulments are not based on chances but on whether or not you meet the requirements of the law. From the post, it looks like you don't meet the requirements. Get a divorce attorney to help you.

I am getting a sense that you'd like the fact that annulment is fault based, but you really need a divorce.

Good luck.
You are probably not going to be able to get an annulment. This link explains the grounds for an annulment in California: http://www.courts.ca.gov/1037.htm.
